Reviews.Title: “OMG! Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Funguy11
Reviews.Content: I have never written a bad review until now! This is also the first time I check out of a hotel and call the health department. I moved from the Clarion next door because there rates went up and check into this dump! The desk person was a woman that spoke little English, even through the parking lot was dark only one side of the building lit up I thought what the heck it only $29. First they said they had no rooms for $29 (even through the sign said $29) so I paid $39. I went to my room it was ok till I turned on the lights…well the 2 lights that worked. Bed had hair in it there were burn marks all over the carpet the bathroom light would not stay on the toilet did not flush and had a present in it from the last guest. The hall to get to the room was covered in mold and the lobby was about 20 degrees. Went to the desk to ask for another room and on the way there was told by an older blond I could have a good time for $25 at this point the room and her combined would not have been worth $25( noticed 3 other working girls). Asked the desk person for a new room was told they did not have one (keep in mind there were only 4 cars in the dark lot). So I asked for my money back and was told simply “no”. So I went back to the Clarion next door! I paid $69 and was happy to do so! Lesson learned, if the parking lot is empty and dark and the desk person does not speak English pay more!

Reviews.Title: “We hated this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lbi219
Reviews.Content: We made reservation through FDM Travel Denmark ..when we arrive in the hotel the Parking was dark, and the lobby was hot and dirty according to our reservation it comes with breakfast, but they told us we don't serve breakfast on Monday. When we went upstairs, the bedroom was horrible dirty, smelly , old and hot. Please do not stay in this hotel it looks beautiful in the Picture, but it looks horror inside we ended checking out that night and stayed in the different hotel...."Bates" Hotel

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: LubbockTexas
Reviews.Content: Great hotel clean rooms nice bathroom comfy beds.The bar was great had good food the fitness center was clean free parking airport shuttle clean swimming pool.I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nesting bed for Nasty Truck Drivers”
Reviews.Author: mrharvey86
Reviews.Content: This was by far the worse place I have ever stayed. I am female and I was there to visit a friend. I found out that the owners of this hotel also own a trucking company (Nationwide Carriers) and they run the trucking company out of the hotel. I saw a ton of 18-wheelers around back. That is why their parking lot is full of potholes. When I was there, I was walking out the front door and two nasty, dirty truck drivers approached me and said that they have a community room (I think it is room 146 if my memory serves me correctly) and I look like I like to have fun and asked me to come to their rooms. I was scared, and I lied and said I was waiting on my husband to come to the lobby. The truck drivers said they stay in the hotel for free because it is their home office for their company and they love to have fun. This hotel is also lurking with prostitutes, who know about the trucker room. You can see these women walking around the halls and the management is aware, but they don't care. They allow these women to come into their establishment to "please their drivers". I am a family oriented person, and I did realize such things existed. All the other negative comments about the rooms are correct, from holes in the ceiling to one of the hallway walls completely exposed to the outside world. It is not safe, and after one night I was out of there. I am writing this review to warn people about the dangers they are in with these horny, nasty truck driver's they have lurking around the place. One truck driver said to me they are bored cause they don't have a car and their boss won't let them drive the big truck, so all they do is walk the halls looking for a "good time." Everyone - beware! Oh yeah, and the black lady at the counter is VERY RUDE, and the Indian guy that was there the next morning was acting and talking like he was a rapper, and he was rude. Just a really weird experience for me. I won't be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: camoang
Reviews.Content: We booked this motel based on both price (we were traveling on a very tight budget) and proximity to the airport and Graceland when we were in Memphis. We were in town both for a wedding but also to do some sightseeing at Graceland and downtown. We were a little hesitant upon driving to the motel and upon check-in based on the look of the motel and all the strip clubs we passed on our way there but it was very late and we were exhausted so we figured we'd sleep there and then find somewhere else for our other 2 nights if necessary. The hallway had a bit of a urine smell but our room, sheets and bathroom were clean and the motel was very quiet. We didn't hear a peep out of anyone else. We did have to ask for directions at the front desk and the employees were always very friendly and helpful. The room was clean, housekeeping did their job and we felt safe. Airport Inn isn't a luxury resort by any means but the only time we spent there was to shower and sleep and for the price it wasn't bad.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: CaribbeanAleen
Reviews.Content: i read with amusement the critics on this hotel you would think that they paid Hilton prices and expect Buckingham Palace Service. I am not related in any way to this establishment but I believe that with the price i paid it was well worth it. Maybe these are people who expect to pay pennies for a meal and expect a five course meal ate but hey when i am on vacation i need a clean, safe environment and this hotel delivered. I was especially taken aback by the friendliness of the staff and a manager by the name of Karnail .

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay during Elvis Presley week!”
Reviews.Author: elvis4life
Reviews.Content: Well I just stumbled upon this site & I've read all of the negative responses about this hotel. If what everyone's saying that happened to them during their stay is true, I feel sorry for them & NOBODY deserves that type of treatment in ANY hotel that a customer pays to stay at. However from the experience that I had there in 8/2007, I can tell you that I had nothing but a great time at this hotel. I had a nice room to stay at, air conditioner was working in the 100+ degree weather & the staff was friendly. And for those wondering, no I'm NOT associated with ANYONE at this hotel, I'm just a customer from NY that had a great time during Elvis Week at my stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Check in with extreme caution”
Reviews.Author: RuralNYtraveler
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay here while visiting the Memphis area mostly because of the good rate. Of course, you get what you pay for but it seemed ok for me. However I needed to check out 1 day early and they charged my card for the full 5 nights I originally planned instead of the 4 nights . If you choose to stay don't let them charge your account ahead of time. I'm still fighting for 1 nights credit on my card. The desk people have no authority and I'm told that I need to talk to the "manager" named Gary who is like chasing a ghost. I wouldn't recommend this hotel mainly because there seems to be no accountability or customer service.

Reviews.Title: “A sewer I would not use to home the homeless.......”
Reviews.Author: theresa777
Reviews.Content: THIS HOTEL NEEDS TO BE BLOCKED FROM ALL HOTEL BOOKING SITES. It needs to be demolished......The rooms were HOT AND FILTHY! There were used wet bath towels from previous customers that were left hanging in the shower and on the floor of the room, and this was at 4:00 in the evening. A room should be clean by this time of the day by house keeping. I don't think that this hotel has housekeeping as filthy as it was.....I never saw anyone from housekeeping in the hotel, at all. The beds were stained and unmade, and there were bed bugs in the beds. The walls had the appearance of mold on them.......AT LEAST I HOPE THAT'S WHAT IT WAS, BECAUSE MY FIRST THOUGHT WAS THAT IT WAS FECES. Shortly after I had checked in, I went to the front desk to get a refund, but the clerks at the front desk FLAT OUT REFUSED to give me a refund, and when I asked to speak to the manager, he refused to come out to speak to me. Overall, the staff was very rude and nasty, and rather than stay in this sewer for one minute, I just considered the money spent on this piece of dump a complete loss, and I went to a better, much cleaner, and reputable hotel for a room. I would never recommend this hell hole of a hotel for anyone to stay in. It is a HOT, NASTY HOTEL and don't stay in it UNLESS YOU DO NOT MIND TAKING THE RISK OF CATCHING A COMMUNICABLE DISEASE....STD OR WORST........... IF SOMEONE RECOMMENDS THIS HOTEL TO YOU, DON'T WALK AWAY...RUN!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “staying in hell”
Reviews.Author: ckrey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Memphis and just dropped into the Airport Inn. All seemed well until we got checked in and got to our room. The room smelled horrible, the walls were a color I can't even describe, the floors were nasty, and I was even afraid to go to the bathroom. The bathroom was NASTY!! I even refused to use the toilet paper there. The bathroom also had other peoples hair in the tub and pee everywhere. There were homeless people walking around once it got dark and other creepy people about. They say you get a continental breakfast in their pamplets, but then acted like we were stupid when we asked about it. We tried talking to the front desk about leaving and they refused to give us our money back even tho we just checked in. She was rude and was cursing at me. I would not recommend this place even to my worst enemy. This place should really be shut down. I have stayed in some bad places but this is the first time that I couldn't even go to sleep because I feared for my life!

Reviews.Title: “sound good but look closer”
Reviews.Author: bugsClaremore
Reviews.Content: feb 25 2008 if your like to swim then this is not the place, my grandkid like to swim but the pool was in on place to take the kids. If you went in the day time and if the door was not open you had to go outside to get to the pool. The fans were going 24/7 and at night well that was a hole in the wall. their was only one light the was on and the pool light were not use. Yes they had a indoor pool, but to get to it was a long walk. Oh to get a pool towel you have to bring the one in the room so they hold it for a clean one. so i went to the store and get 5 for us. the price is right but you get what you pay for the next time we go i will not stay at this place. bertha The people at the front did not know how to get from point A to point B

Reviews.Title: “Rember you are in Memphis!!!!”
Reviews.Author: FlordiaSrtraveler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel staff was helpful,no problems here. this hotel is old but most in this area are,lobby was nice room suited our needs.Sheets were changed daily and room was cleaned. Out side primiter needs some cleaning as people dont know how to put trash in cans,also weeds need to be trimed. If you need phone lines they are helpful but most of us have a cell phone today. Contact Hotel direct for best prices, found prices higher through Hotels .com.Got ripped of here with their price. This was Elvis week hotel .com price $80.00 a night>>> Hotel price $59.95.....Check it out dont let this happen to you. We all think the internet is saving us money but youi really have to do a lot of checking not to get ripped of.Being a sr citizen I think this is a bad practice. There is an old saying get it from the horses mouth.>>>so in the future I will deal directly with the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a recommendation”
Reviews.Author: Mattokun
Reviews.Content: There is no less than 1 point for this hotel, so I'll stick to 1. But this not really reflects my opinion about it. It's a really horribel hotel. And I've stayed in quite some hotels. I mean, I did have hotels worse than that. But that was at countrysides of 3rd world countries. Well, anyways... it's basically all been said in other evaluations. The room was reasonably big, but that's about all positive one can say about it. It was nasty and loud. Towels were not really something one would like to dry up with after taking a shower with barely lukewarm water. The biggest disappointment was the breakfast, however. Not only was the breakfast room run down and looked like a construction site. The waitress also said that that day, she was out of gas and could not warm up the breakfast. Things happen, but then still charging $1.50 for a banana instead of giving bananas and apples (since there was nothing else there, no bread or bagels, jam or yogurt, nothing) away for free as a courtesy to the guests is just not the right way (to say it politely). We stayed in this hotel only because we came at a bad time when all other hotels were full, and the only place we could get late at night was this hotel. But I don't recommend staying there, unless it's like an emergency and you otherwise have to sleep in the car. It's not for no reason that a sign at the reception says "No refunds"...

Reviews.Title: “THE worst place in my life!!!”
Reviews.Author: sxs0797
Reviews.Content: We just came back from the worst hotel/motel experience. The Airport Inn should not operate their business. Where should I begin? The overall room - it was smelly, molded, cracks in the wall, stains everywhere, and very badly installed windows (if you stay here, don't even think about staying the first floor. Someone can easily break into your room). The worst towel provided ever - only two medium size were provided for 2 adults. they were smelly and the color were gray and yellow, but I assumed these were originally white. The cold shower - the water coming out from the pipe felt not clean. The bed - cigarette burns and smell. We asked for non-smoking room, yet, there was an ashtray... The NOISE from the airport and the highway - I could not sleep. I am usually not sensitive to noise during my sleep, but this place is an exception. Every 5 minutes I woke up due to airplanes and car/trucks! The NOISE from others staying and working here - Wow, the entire night someone was walking, talking, laughing and yes fighting. Another reason I woke up every 5 minutes. The breakfast - we were told that there would be a complementary full-service breakfast incl. eggs, bacon, hasbrown, toast etc. No, no, no! The woman at the breakfast room told us that they had no gas. She did not even give us toast, but she tried to sell us banana for $1.50. The other customers - yes, it won't harm to bring a bullet proof jacket. Scary, scary, scary! Some people are not just staying here but living here! A homeless shelter may be even better than here! One man who wanted to use the PC (yes, there is one PC for the internet access) for more than 15 min limit. He started cursing a receptionist and others who were waiting for the PC. He said "you were a --- racist, I demand an apology" etc. It was scary. The reception - later we found out that there was a sign over the reception "No Refund, No Exception". We now know why. At least we were lucky to book for one night. The price - not worth for paying $53.99 plus tax! I had a better place in the past for this price! We want our money back! Please please stay away from this place. Drive some more if you cannot find any other place, please beleive me! I have not posted this negative review before, and I am not a demanding person, but this place is the worst in the US, the worst in the world! If you are a state/federal agent, please search and inspect this place please!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this motel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Please learn from my mistake and do not stay at this establishment. It is dirty, rundown and spooky. We made a reservation through Orbitz for a non-smoking room but were initially placed in a smoking room that reeked. The second room was actually worse. My daughter's feet were blackened from walking across the carpeting barefoot. The furniture was covered in an oily film. We complained and requested a refund but were refused. We were so digusted that we left and booked another motel on our own. I contacted Orbitz and they tried to intervene but management still refused a refund. Orbitz said it would send a representative to do a facility review.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for $40”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 2 nights at the end of Dec 2005 and didn't have any major problems. They hadn't received the reservations we made the day before at hotels dot com but they let us checkin w/o too much fuss anyway. The hotel is kinda run-down but it was clean enough and everything worked. Due to the neighborhood and some of the other guests, I felt a little less safe than in other hotels but nothing bad happened and the staff was helpful and courteous. Our non-smoking room included a fridge and microwave but don't expect Hilton-level or even Comfort Inn accomodations. The reasons to stay here are the low cost and close-to-Graceland location.

Reviews.Title: “Yep, it's all true....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed shortly after Katrina and the hotel was full of refugees from New Orleans - so I would like to be charitable. Unfortunately there's no excuse for the hotel being so grotty. The carpets were smelly. The rooms were stale . The corridors are dark and unpleasant. We booked a non smoking room with breakfast. We got a smoking room and no breakfast. We stayed one night and put it down to experience. One positive point. It is really close to Graceland- 2 max minutes by car. You can even walk it. Wish I'd read these reviews before booking. Guess it serves me right!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I couldn't believe the service and quality of this hotel. I was on vacation with my wife and two boys and wanted to spend a few days in Memphis and a few days in Nashville and thought cheaper was better at the time. HOLY COW I WAS WRONG!!! The breakfast was terrible, they would only serve my wife and I and I had to pay for the boys, we got up and left. That evening we came back from a full days worth of touring and hit the pool. We found a couple making love in the sauna. The pool had so much junk floating in it that we decided it wasn't a good idea to get in...and it was an indoor pool. All (and I mean all) the electrical lighting and appliances in the room were tied into one extention cord and the microwave in the room didn't work. We called the front and they sent down a gentlemen that was right out of a rap video with no name badge or uniform of the hotel and he reached right behind the "master" electrical extention cord and wiggled it as if he's done it a few times before, it started working of course my degree of comfort was at an all time low. The beds were not level to the world, the floors were filthy (black socks were once white). I went to get additional towels from the front desk and they asked for ID...I thought they wanted to see if I were a guest or not, the lady rips my ID out of my hand, and hides it somewhere behind the counter, looks me straight in the eye and says "If you want your ID back, you better bring back those towels." My wife and I still talk about the awful treatment and quality of the hotel...Oh yeah there's two guard shacks that weren't manned while I stayed there, you won't need your door access cards for physical access into the hotel since the doors are broken to stay open. Safety is really not a factor when staying at the Airport Inn...

Reviews.Title: “Just great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Airport Inn 21/05 ot 23/05. Best location. Shuttle to and from airport and Graceland. The friendliest and most helpful people. They go out of there way to make you feel right at home. Thank you to all for making our stay very pleasureable.

Reviews.Title: “Scary”
Reviews.Author: Kingstonklein
Reviews.Content: Carpet alternated between smelling like a sour unwashed dog and bad bathroom deodorizer. The windows are not secure and look like they're easy to open from the outside with a bit of jiggling. The room phone doesn't work. You can't call long distance, housekeeping, or your friends in other rooms. They don't change the sheets. Not all rooms have a sofa or a hair dryer. In the stairwell, there was a slice of pizza that was on the floor the whole three days we were there. The hallway was dark and dingy. The electrical outlets were overloaded. The back parking lot also dubbles as a truck stop. There is a little shed marked "security guard", but there never was a guard posted there. It's a bad idea to stay here. Please cancel your reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely bad service - do not go there!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had reservation for two days in January 2004. No possible to call outside Memphis or use the Internet. Extremely bad smelly room, dirty. Bad service, arrogants. I checked out after 15 minutes because I couldn't use the phone and Internet (I need to stay in contact with customers). Guess what: they charged me with 2 nights, full package. I called Hotels. They said of course is not their problem. I called the hotel and they said nothing can be done. From now on, is sure nobody in my company will make reservations through Hotels and TravelNow. Airport Hotel Memphis: bad, bad bussiness.

Reviews.Title: “most horrible hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A friend and I booked a room at the Airport Inn for New Year's Eve 2003. I had booked the room through an internet company the week before so I called the hotel itself the day of our arrival in Memphis to double check on our room reservation. Airport Inn denied having a reservation, so I had to make several more calls to them and the internet company to remedy their mistake. The WORST thing though was that we did not have a working shower in our room and so neither of us were able to take a shower the next morning. The manager said she would give us a discount on the room if we called the internet company. When I followed through with this, the internet co told me the hotel refused to give me a discount because they supposedly offered us another room, which they never did. And the room was disgustingly gross! Awful experience, never stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Wrong Rating”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms at this hotel for November 5-11, 2003 based on the rating and information I received from Hotel who I know must have never stayed there or sent a repersenative to this place.FIRST, the hotel had the wrong dates for our stay which I booked and confirmed on July 25, 2003. SECOND, the rooms were very old, outdated, smelled, carpet unkempt, bathroom unclean, and closet nonexistence. THIRD, I had to go to a local store and purchase cleaning products for the room. FOURTH, during the 5 nights stay the hotel NEVER changed the sheets NEVER. They made the bed and gave more towels period..nothing else. Didn't clean the tub just towels and a made up bed. FIFTH, the hotel offers free breakfast this is a BIG JOKE. The breakfast was so, so, so, bad I don't have words to describe it. I can only say please stay away please. SIXTH, when we checked out the hotel manager WOULD NOT give us a receipt he said that we had to get our receipt for our stay at this place from Hotel .My FINAL Note is if you have booked reservations at Airport (DUMP) Inn cancel immediately!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel no way 3-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Dont mean to be negative, and never have before, but we reserved 2-non smoking rooms. ROOM (204)1. Had cigarette burns all over the tub and sink countertop. 2. It also had cigarette burns in the carpet3. One burn hole in the fitted sheet 4. The shower had soap scum all over it. 5. The toilet did not flush correctly (had to flush twice) 6. Linens did not smell fresh (hope they were clean!!) the other room (205) 1. Had cigarette burns in the carpet. 2. Later that night the sliding glass door was unlocked and slightly open. 3. One of the towels had a small kinky hair on it. 4. You could feel the springs in the mattress with your hand. called down to office and asked if they could change out mattress,(to bad to sleep on) they said they would have maintenance come and take care of problem. They never came to fix problem. Both ice machines one on the 1st floor and one on the second floor were broke. had to go to the bar area and ask for some ice... The carpet in both rooms were dirty. Room 204 had a bottle cap and cigarette clear wrapper in floor. you would have to wipe your feet off with your dirty clothes before getting into bed.

HotelInfo.Name: Airport Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 1441 East Brooks Road, Memphis, TN 38116
